mechanoreception.notes: Land planarians are sensitive to physical contact, which they use to hunt and capture invertebrate prey. They use physical force to subdue prey.

chemoreception.notes: They use adhesive and digestive properties of their mucus to capture and digest prey. This implies chemoreception for prey detection and assessment of food sources.

hygroreception.notes: They are very sensitive to humidity variations in their environment due to the lack of water-retaining mechanisms. Therefore, they likely possess specialized hygroreceptors.
